images.caption: Figure 1:Overview of our core contributions. We identify the trade-off between accuracy and throughput for systems that require verifying a large number of programs. Through a generate-prune-then-rank strategy, we show that the trade-off can be improved. By filtering candidates with a weak verifier, the ORM can then rank more accurately than the ORM alone and efficiently compared to the strongest verifier.

Figure 2:Trade-off curves for the 14B generator. The colors represent different ranking strategies, while the markers represent different pruning methods. â€œMajority Votingâ€ is the verifier-only setup where we use majority voting to select the best candidate after pruning with the weak verifier. We report the full results inAppendixÂ Iand other model curves inAppendixÂ H.
